intro: Casearia luteocarpa, commonly known as the yellow-fruited casearia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that turns yellow when mature, containing numerous tiny seeds. Casearia luteocarpa is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
